clinical_study.brief_title: Tissue Oxygenation During Treatment of Infant Congenital Heart Defects
clinical_study.official_title: Tissue Oxygenation During Treatment of Infant Congenital Heart Defects

brief_summary.textblock:
To investigate the correlation between tissue oxygen saturation (StO2) monitored at different locations (forehead, kidney region, and abdominal wall) and patient outcomes (cerebral, renal, GI, and composite complication) in pediatric patients undergoing open cardiac surgery.
Intraoperative hemodynamic parameters were monitored by Mostcare. Renal near infrared spectroscopy (NIRS) was continuously measured from the time of anesthesia to the time of transfer from the operating room to pediatric cardiac ICU. Baseline renal oximetry was determined as the average value for 2 minutes of recording after general anesthesia. Infants with a than 20% reduction from baseline for 20 consecutive minutes was defined as low renal oximetry events, and infants were divided into low renal oximetry group (LR group) and normal renal oximetry group (NR group). Pediatric-corrected RIFLE (pRIFLE) criteria was used to diagnose postoperative AKI. The incidence of AKI, lactic acid, duration of mechanical ventilation, and hospital length of stay were recorded after surgery.

detailed_description.textblock:
Using near-infrared spectroscopy（NIRS） to monitor intraoperative and postoperative tissue oxygen saturation (brain, kidney, intestine) and to investigate the correlation with postoperative complications.
A NIRS sensor(CASMED, Branford, CT, USA) will be placed on forehead to monitor the cerebral tissue oxygen saturation (StO2) of frontal cortex; another sensor will be placed on the left posterior flank (i.e., T12-L2, thoracolumbar paraspinal region) to monitor renal oximetry (SkO2, approximating the renal vascular bed); and the forth sensor will be placed subumbilical on either side of the central bladder region to assess intestinal oxygenation (SiO2). All the sensors will be connected to FIGHTSIGHT (CASMED, Branford ,CT, USA) to collect tissue oximetry data.
The electronic data streams from the NIRS and other patient monitors will be collected into a study computer. Data collection will initiate at pre-induction of anesthesia in the operating room. Only the NIRS values will be blinded from clinical use. Blood samples for determining biomarkers of ischemic tissue injury will be taken at defined intervals. No other modifications to clinical practice will occur while conducting the study and the NIRS monitoring is non-invasive.

The incidence of AKI, lactic acid, duration of mechanical ventilation, and hospital length of stay were recorded after surgery.

primary_outcome.description: Diagnosis by RIFLE criteria which including serum creatinine and urine volume. Serum creatinine is measured everyday within the first 3 days after surgery, and urine volume is measured 6, 12, 24, 48 hours after surgery.

secondary_outcome.description: Acute kidney injury serum biomarkers. Serum creatinine is measured within 7 days after surgery. If the patient has renal failure after surgery, serum samples are obtained daily in ICU, until the patient leaves the ICU.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age ≤ 1 year
- Diagnosis of congenital heart disease
- Undergoing cardiac surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Lack of parental or guardian consent
- Emergent or urgent procedure
- Pre-existing congenital abnormality of any other organs
- Skin condition where near infrared spectroscopy monitoring is contraindicated
